title: An Introduction to the World of Transportation
text:
Preface
This book’s goal is to give you an overview of the world of transportation.
This will hopefully give you the know-how to generally understand:

the bureaucratic structures,
domain-specific terminology, and
technological steps

requisite to becoming useful in this domain.
Just like lots of things in transportation, this book is definitely not perfect and should always be considered a work in progress. Feel free to reach out to me if you think something could be improved or would be a good addition to the text.
As always though, press on!

title: Introduction
text:
There’s always the great temptation to read and book and feel like you’ve done something.
This book’s goal is not that. It’s to help you get stuff done.
Specifically, this book’s goal is to help you know where you and where you want to go in the world of transportation.
The main focus will be on working with and implementing transportation technology.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

title: 1  How Many Layers Are There?
text:
1.1 The big picture
Basic infrastructure (think interstates, highways, and common roads) is considered a common good by most people. With that said, how it’s built, how it’s maintained, and how people use it have generally fallen into the domain of government.
